basic.floral_language:
Trachycarpus fortunei
Floriography: lofty, Pretty, brave
Trachycarpus fortunei is a tree, loftier than regular foliage plants, with an upright and graceful stem, nearly round leaves, leathery, shiny and smooth, parted with many lanceolate-shape leaflets forming a palm. Suitable for the yard, roadside, and flower beds.
Trachycarpus fortunei like light, tolerate half shade. Bloom in April to May if conditions are good, yellow-green or light green flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowering in April-May, yellow green or light green flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
